title: What is the best way to introduce Shakespeare to an 11 year old? - Quora

response.answer_text: There are some truly wonderful books written specifically with the goal of introducing kids to Shakespeare! Try this website: 10 best Shakespeare books for kids | Rhapsody of Words | The Shakespeare Standard This is a little non-traditional but a lot of fun—you’ll have to kind of explore the whole website: Shakespeare Ebooks you can read to or can be read by children that are simplified Shakespeare that “Use simplified language, with Shakespeare’s original language retained where it is simple and clear; Are a thrilling, absorbing reads that gives children a clear understanding of the play and a strong feel of the original”: Shakespeare's Plays For Children Happy reading!

Well, start with reading her one of his plays and then going into a lesson about the man who wrote it. I know that one of Shakespeare’s plays in novel/book format is pretty daunting for an 11 year old, so I’d suggest starting with a graphic novel version. They make ones that are basic and are not word for word, but rather are a summary with the key quotes. I read several of these when I was in sixth grade. The other option is the verbatim play, but accompanied by pictures so it looks just like a comic book with old English that is made easier to understand by the visuals. Both are pretty good options, depending on the level you feel he/she is ready to go to. I hope this helps!
